content: not 8 with the main colour repeating over the four round at the end this gives a more balanced final look pattern repeat below eg mc c1 c2 knit two rounds each and repeat change to contrast colour knit one round pattern repeat cast off purlwise round 1 k1 yfwd sl1 yb k3 yfwd sl1 yb repeat bracketed sequence to last 2 sts k2 break off yarn pull tight and secure weave in ends round 2 k1 sl1 k3 sl1 repeat bracketed sequence to last 2 sts k2 **you can choose to omit the contrast cast on and bind off round 3 k3 yfwd sl1 yb repeat bracketed sequence to and working entirely in main colour end round 4 k3 sl1 repeat bracketed sequence to end a note on colour selection the mosaic stitch pattern creates a tessellating pattern which produces an optical illusion depending on the colours you select if you want defined tessellations then ensure you select two colous with very high contrast to each other with a third in a mid tone for an optical illusionary effect select three yarns all in the mid tone as pictured above
